Spinal Cord.questionText: The true statement about the spinal cord is:
options: The spinal dura end at the level of S4.
The filum terminale is a fold of pia below the termination of spinal cord attached to the coccyx.
The largest radicular artery is that of S2.

options: White matter develops in the marginal zone.
Dorsal root ganglia are derived from the neural crest cells.
At birth spinal cord ends at the level of the first lumbar vertebra.
Mantle zone gives rise to the grey matter.

options: Communicates with the 4th ventricle through the cerebral aqueduct.
The corpus callosum is a direct superior relation.
Has a recess related to the optic chiasma.
Is bounded anteriorly by the lamina terminalis.

options: Its body forms the roof of the trunk (body) of lateral ventricle.
